data.title: [0.10.7] Should a developer's name show up in source for insiders build?
data.body:
I know we're not talking release quality code, that this is still beta...but I do wonder if `Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/jrieken.vscode-omnisharp/bin/omnisharp' with process id 47120...` should be there. The error is that Omnisharp is not starting "[ERROR:OmniSharp.Dnx.DesignTimeHostManager] Failed to launch DesignTimeHost in a timely fashion." 
But the main question is if code should include developers' names or be more generically named.

data.title: Support to open a project folder in multiple VS Code windows

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently VS Code prevents opening a folder more than once which makes it impossible to work on a project in multiple windows (e.g. on multiple displays).

@bpasero @dbaeumer @egamma @alexandrudima please raise any obstacles and issues you might foresee with this request.
 
Issues found so far:
- [ ] we use the workspace path as identifier to communicate back from debug target to debug host
- [ ] we need to verify cross platform that there is no code causing issues when running over the same root folder (e.g. file watchers) 

---

**Please note:** Initially I've created this feature request for a specific use case: enable debugging of multiple processes.
In the meantime, debugging of multiple processes has become possible without the need for opening a folder more than once (see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13426). But instead of closing this item (as no longer necessary), I've repurposed it by removing the specific debug use case.
For transparency you can find the original comment below:

> Currently it is not possible to debug more than one process from a single VS Code project (= window)
> because VS Code prevents opening a folder more than once.
> 
> The workaround is to open VS code on a subfolder within the original folder, which means to restructure the project (which is not desirable).
> 
> This feature request asks for lifting the constraint and allowing to open a project folder multiple times. 
>

data.title: Node debugging crashes after console output after update to Node 4.2.6
data.body:
The node debugger in VS Code seems to die after the first console.log output. While I am not 100% sure this is the actual problem, I don't recall ever having a problem until I upgraded to Node 4.2.6 (current LTS version).

No output, no warnings. VS Code itself does not crash.

If there is a log I can reference to help with this issue report, I am happy to look if given some instructions on how to find it.

For what it's worth, outside this issue, VS Code is hands down the best node debugger tool I have used.

data.title: Oceanic next color scheme support
data.body:
[Oceanic next](http://labs.voronianski.com/oceanic-next-color-scheme/) is a very popular textmate color scheme optimised for es6 / es7 / JSX.

I imported the [textmate theme](https://github.com/voronianski/oceanic-next-color-scheme/blob/master/Oceanic%20Next.tmTheme) and made the changes to the `JavaScript.tmLanguage` file mentioned here [https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/133](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/133), however the results are quite different to the same textmate theme in sublime.
## Sublime

![Image](http://i.imgur.com/fpZCYth.png)
## VSCode

![Image](http://i.imgur.com/eiKIWda.png)

Its a beautiful theme used by the likes of [Sebastian McKenzie, Paul Irish and Dan Abramov](http://labs.voronianski.com/oceanic-next-color-scheme/#Community) and I would love to see equivalent support for this theme in VSCode.

data.title: Go to Definition does not work when using AMD
data.body:
It just does nothing unless its a local variable.
I would have suspected this would present a list of all possible matching items in the source.
Its almost as if its not even indexing the code. I am working in a source base of millions of lines of JS so it would be nice.
Products like resharper and visual assist do this better.

data.title: console output doesn't appear on separate lines in Windows
data.body: On Windows separate console.logs don't appear on separate lines in the debug console, they form one single (long) line that wraps.

data.title: Add LICENSE link to command palette for installing extensions
data.body:
We need to add a direct link to the license (if specified) for an extension:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/12795070/3189191c-ca6d-11e5-877f-fcc45bffc83e.png)

If no license link is present, we should not show the LICENSE button.

Otherwise, the behavior should be the same as launching the link to the README.  The browser opens to the page and in the product we prompt whether or not to install the extension.

data.title: crashes during coding several times per day
data.body:
I love the editor, but it crashes a lot and doesn't give me a useful error. It just says it crashed. I looked around for a crash log to include, but didn't find one.

I know this a terrible bug report, but IDK what else to say. How can I provide more info?

data.title: "Go to Definition" does not work for locating types & methods external to project folder structure
data.body:
For classes and methods found outside of my project's folder structure, I am unable to go to definition. The editor knows how to pull in the excerpt for the description, however, upon clicking the "Go to Definition" button, it does nothing.

For ASP.NET 5, all framework references have been moved into nuget packages, so they are all external to my project's folder structure.

How should I go about figuring out what particular types and methods look like in ASP.NET 5 that are located in nuget packages? Is there an easier way to figure out which nuget package a particular class or method comes from?

data.title: [0.10.7-insiders] Can't launch "Code - Insiders.exe" easily from the command line
data.body: One thing that is helpful about the mainline VS Code release is that it's easy to launch `code.exe` from the command line.  The Insiders release has an exe titled `Code - Insiders.exe` which is impossible to launch from PATH in the command line (as far as I can tell).  I'd recommend renaming that to `code-insiders.exe` so that its easier to resolve from PATH.  For now I have to specify the full path to the EXE just so I can run with the `--extensionDevelopmentPath` parameter.

data.title: Insider Update not updating
data.body:
Having added `"update.channel": "insiders"` to my settings.json, and restarted...I'm not getting any updates. This is running on Windows 7. Even if I tell it to check for updates, I get the prompt that tells me nothing is available. 

Part of the assumption in this report is that it's available, since I'm seeing others post that they are using 0.10.7, which is not "officially" out yet.

data.title: Multiline quickinfo widget in 0.10.7
data.body:
One of the features I like the most in 0.10.6 is the multi line quickinfo widget that appears when a symbol is hovered. It looks like this in 0.10.6:

![quickinfowidget0 10 6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3448684/12784325/cbbc03b4-ca86-11e5-8b31-38c7fc9731a3.png)

In 0.10.7 it looks like this:

![quickinfowidget0 10 7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3448684/12784332/d6990084-ca86-11e5-8e9b-2a3d8717dc17.png)

It's the same version of the same plugin used for both screenshots. As you can see the widget's content is cut. Is there a way to turn on word wrap again in 0.10.7?

data.title: Breakpoints not working when using absolutes paths
data.body: when I set an absolute path in the 'cwd' of my debug config the program is not stoping on breakpoints. It works fine when using relative paths.

data.title: Accessible Debugging
data.body:
At some point we should find out how an accessible debug session looks like. Debug is highly interactive so I can only assume that there needs to be some feedback reporting to the user what the state of the debugged application is in. Some thoughts:
- announce when the program has started and debug session is active
- announce when it stops or a breakpoint is hit
- announce when an error is hit

I pushed a change (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/46db05eec39a1b01eab19925a98d8307dc277f03) so that the trees in the debug viewlet (Variables, Expressions, Call Stack, Breakpoints) get announced with some meaningful data when focus is in the tree and a screen reader is connected. However, I am not sure how verbose the data should be from each of the views because the entries within can have quite some state. I suggest to check with other tools and maybe do the same.

@isidorn @weinand @stevencl @chrisdias fyi

data.title: Use different color for 'console' output category
data.body:
Debug adapters usually use the three OutputEvent categories like this:
- stdout: output produced by the debuggee
- stderr: error output produced by the debuggee
- console: for information produced by the debug adapter itself, e.g. how node was launched or tracing information (if enabled)

Currently 'stdout' and 'console' can not be distinguished in the debug console: they both appear in black.
I suggest to use blue for the console category (or/and an italic font if possible).

data.title: Not supporting TypeScript feature "Polymorphic 'this' Typing"
Feedback form "how we're doing". Incorrect character count when newline present
data.body: To reproduce. - click smiley in the bottom right of editor window. The feedback form should appear - enter several characters, press "Enter" (the new line should appear) - continue entering characters while you can You should stop at "1 character**s** left" (declensions?) After that you will not be able to enter anything On the screenshot. There's a newline after "1". I reached the end of input and unable to enter more characters. But counter still says _"1 characters left"_: _Mac OS 10.10.5 Yosemite_

data.title: Provide action to "Open definition to the side"
ASP.NET OmniSharp server is not running on Ubuntu Mono
data.body:
After [setting up VS Code](http://xameeramir.github.io/install-vs-code-ubuntu-linux/), I'm trying to run an [ASP.NET 5](http://asp.net/vnext) project using [Visual studio code](https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/editor/debugging)'s [command palette](https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/editor/codebasics) on [Ubuntu Linux 14.4](http://releases.ubuntu.com/14.04/).

The [DNVM installed is for Mono](http://xameeramir.github.io/configure-net-ubuntu-linux/). Following the steps given on [VS code's official docs](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/runtimes/ASPnet5), the project is created with [Yeoman scaffolder](http://yeoman.io/).

Whenever trying to start the project, I get the following error:

> OmniSharp server is not running. 

I found some posts when trying to solve this but most seems to be addressing either [Console project](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-IN/library/0wc2kk78%28v=vs.90%29.aspx) or are given for [OS x](http://www.apple.com/in/osx/):
- [For a Console App](http://michaelcrump.net/creating-and-debugging-console-apps-with-vscode/#comment-2483329387)
- [This is for debugging not running](http://stackoverflow.com/a/33861576/2404470)
- The output of `mono --version` shows that it is [>3.12](https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/editor/debugging#_mono-debugging):

[![enter image description here](http://i.stack.imgur.com/Ihnqa.png)](http://i.stack.imgur.com/Ihnqa.png)
- [My dnvm is already the latest](http://stackoverflow.com/a/34845933/2404470)

[![DNVM is already the latest](http://i.stack.imgur.com/Y5Rz9.png)](http://i.stack.imgur.com/Y5Rz9.png)

I can run the project by using `dnx web` command from **Terminal**.

However, my simple question:
- How do I run ASP.NET 5 on Ubuntu using **VS Code**?

> Side question : Not sure by when the [debugging will be supported](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/runtimes/ASPnet5#_debugging). Any rumours about [the extension](https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/editor/debugging#_common-questions) will be appreciated. 

[SOURCE](http://stackoverflow.com/q/35068910/2404470)
